```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(lubridate)
library(powerjoin)

theme_set(theme_light(base_family = "Helvetica"))

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


```{r}
samples_raw <- read_excel(
  "argon_concentrations.xlsx",
  sheet = "samples"
) %>%
  separate(
    sample_id,
    into = c("plot", "depth", "time_point"),
    sep = "-",
    remove = FALSE
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    across(date, as.character),
    across(
      plot,
      \(x) recode(x, TLP = "7")
    ),
    across(
      time_point,
      \(x) str_replace(x, fixed("TP"), "") %>%
        recode(`IN` = "0") %>%
        as.numeric()
    )
  )

controls_raw <- read_excel(
  "argon_concentrations.xlsx",
  sheet = "controls"
) %>%
  mutate(
    across(
      control_type,
      \(x) recode(x, AMBIENT = "ambient", `Spike (Initial)` = "spike")
    ),
    across(date, as.character)
  ) %>%
  separate(
    sample_id,
    into = c("plot", "depth", "x"),
    sep = "-",
    remove = FALSE
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    across(
      plot,
      \(x) recode(x, TLP = "7")
    )
  ) %>%
  select(-x)
```


```{r}
controls <- controls_raw %>%
  select(-sample_id) %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(`28`, `29`, `30`, Ar),
    names_to = "species",
    values_to = "concentration"
  ) %>%
  # This is just to add missing ambient controls and
  # replace their values with the mean of controls
  # at the same date and plot
  bind_rows(
    anti_join(
      samples_raw %>%
        pivot_longer(
          cols = c(Ar),
          names_to = "species",
          values_to = "concentration"
        ) %>%
        distinct(date, plot, depth, species) %>%
        crossing(
          control_type = c("ambient", "spike")
        ),
      .,
      by = c("date", "plot", "depth", "species", "control_type")
    )
  ) %>%
  group_by(date, plot, control_type, species) %>%
  mutate(
    across(
      concentration,
      \(x) replace_na(x, mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))
    )
  ) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = control_type,
    values_from = concentration
  )

sample_dilution <- samples_raw %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = c(Ar),
    names_to = "species",
    values_to = "concentration"
  ) %>%
  power_left_join(
    controls,
    by = c("date", "plot", "depth", "species"),
    check = check_specs(
      duplicate_keys_left = "ignore",
      unmatched_keys_left = "warn",
      duplicate_keys_right = "warn",
      unmatched_keys_right = "warn"
    ),
    suffix = c("_samle", "_control")
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    dilution_factor = (spike - ambient) / (concentration - ambient),
    fraction_remaining = 1 / dilution_factor
  )

```

```{r}
p <- sample_dilution %>%
  ggplot(
    aes(
      hr,
      dilution_factor,
      color = date,
      group = paste0(date, plot, depth)
    )
  ) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  labs(
    x = "Time (hours)",
    y = "Dilution factor",
    color = "Date"
  )

p <- sample_dilution %>%
  mutate(
    across(
      depth,
      \(x) fct_inseq(as.character(x), ordered = TRUE)
    )
  ) %>%
  ggplot(
    aes(
      hr,
      dilution_factor,
      color = depth,
      group = paste0(date, plot, depth)
    )
  ) +
  geom_smooth(
    aes(
      group = depth
    ),
    method = "lm"
    # se = FALSE
  ) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.5) +
  coord_cartesian(
    ylim = c(0.5, 10)
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "Time (hours)",
    y = "Dilution factor",
    color = "Depth (cm)"
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~depth)

ggsave(
  "dilution_factor_by_depth.pdf",
  p, width = 7, height = 5
)
```

```{r}

p <- sample_dilution %>%
  mutate(
    across(
      depth,
      \(x) fct_inseq(as.character(x), ordered = TRUE)
    )
  ) %>%
  ggplot(
    aes(
      hr,
      fraction_remaining,
      color = depth,
      group = paste0(date, plot, depth)
    )
  ) +
  geom_smooth(
    aes(
      group = depth
    ),
    method = "lm"
    # se = FALSE
  ) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    labels = scales::percent_format()
  ) +
  coord_cartesian(
    ylim = c(0, 1)
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "Time (hours)",
    y = "Percent remaining",
    color = "Depth (cm)"
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~depth)


```

Fit model to each depth separately. Don't include intercept because
we know that the dilution factor is 1 at time 0.

```{r}
mods <- sample_dilution %>%
  group_by(depth) %>%
  summarize(
    mod = lm(
      I(dilution_factor - 1) ~ 0 + hr,
      data = cur_data()
    ) %>%
      broom::tidy() %>%
      list(),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  unnest(mod)

```
